Title: CoVibe: Repo Preferences (edit as checkboxes)
Preview:
# CoVibe: Repo Preferences (edit as checkboxes)
- [x] PRs required on main â€” All changes land via PRs; direct pushes blocked.
- [x] 1 review minimum â€” Require 1 approving review to merge.
- [x] CODEOWNERS required â€” Require code-owner review where applicable.
- [x] Linear history â€” No merge commits to main.
- [x] Disallow force-pushes â€” Keep main safe.
- [x] Disallow branch deletions â€” Prevent accidental main deletion.
- [x] README smoke test â€” Fail CI if README is missing/tiny.
- [x] Link check on push â€” Catch broken links early.
- [x] Normalize LF â€” Consistent line endings on text files.
- [x] ASCII in reports â€” Avoid mojibake/encoding gremlins in logs.
- [x] Wait notes in scripts â€” Long steps print a heads-up so contributors donâ€™t Ctrl-C.

# âœ¦ Insight Scroll: Epistemology in the Age of Civium
*A map of knowledge, ignorance, and recursive humility.*

---

## [1] Why This Scroll Exists

In Civium, where decisions emerge from recursive consensus across biological, synthetic, and anomalous minds, knowing how we *know* becomes a foundational virtue.

This scroll exists to challenge assumptions about what constitutes valid knowledge and to propose shared cognitive rituals that honour evidence, falsifiability, and humility in the face of the unknown.

# âœ¦ Insight: Truth Metrics in Civium

Civium operates under the recognition that â€œtruthâ€ is a useful fictionâ€”stable enough to build systems, but volatile enough to evolve. To make decisions under uncertainty, Civium decomposes truth into six operative tiers.

## Tiered Taxonomy of Truth

Civium treats truth as multidimensional. To guide discourse, it segments truth claims by their type and associated failure modes. This enables layered evaluation of proposals or beliefs.

Title: CLI Guardrails (PowerShell)

# CLI Guardrails (PowerShell)

**Always re-orient PS7 before any new instruction set.** Use:

```powershell
C:\Users\Chris\Documents\GitHub\CoModules = Join-Path $HOME 'Documents\GitHub\CoCivium'
if(!(Test-Path -LiteralPath $repo)){ throw "Repo not found: $repo" }
Set-Location -LiteralPath $repo; git status -sb;
```

See `scripts/enter.ps1` for the repo-scoped mutex and `-Force` pattern.
